    4242             : #undef STITCH_TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_OPEN_NAMESPACE
    4243             : 
    4244             : // ----------- #included from clara_compilers.h -----------
    4245             : 
    4246             : #ifndef TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    4247             : #define TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    4248             : 
    4249             : // Detect a number of compiler features - mostly C++11/14 conformance - by compiler
    4250             : // The following features are defined:
    4251             : //
    4252             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR : is nullptr supported?
    4253             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT : is noexcept supported?
    4254             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS : The delete and default keywords for compiler generated methods
    4255             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE : is override supported?
    4256             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR : is unique_ptr supported (otherwise use auto_ptr)
    4257             : 
    4258             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OR_GREATER : Is C++11 supported?
    4259             : 
    4260             : // CLARA_CONFIG_VARIADIC_MACROS : are variadic macros supported?
    4261             : 
    4262             : // In general each macro has a _NO_<feature name> form
    4263             : // (e.g. CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NULLPTR) which disables the feature.
    4264             : // Many features, at point of detection, define an _INTERNAL_ macro, so they
    4265             : // can be combined, en-mass, with the _NO_ forms later.
    4266             : 
    4267             : // All the C++11 features can be disabled with CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11
    4268             : 
    4269             : #ifdef __clang__
    4270             : 
    4271             : #if __has_feature(cxx_nullptr)
    4272             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4273             : #endif
    4274             : 
    4275             : #if __has_feature(cxx_noexcept)
    4276             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4277             : #endif
    4278             : 
    4279             : #endif // __clang__
    4280             : 
    4281             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4282             : // GCC
    4283             : #ifdef __GNUC__
    4284             : 
    4285             : #if __GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 6 && defined(__GXX_EXPERIMENTAL_CXX0X__)
    4286             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4287             : #endif
    4288             : 
    4289             : // - otherwise more recent versions define __cplusplus >= 201103L
    4290             : // and will get picked up below
    4291             : 
    4292             : #endif // __GNUC__
    4293             : 
    4294             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4295             : // Visual C++
    4296             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
    4297             : 
    4298             : #if (_MSC_VER >= 1600)
    4299             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4300             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4301             : #endif
    4302             : 
    4303             : #if (_MSC_VER >= 1900 ) // (VC++ 13 (VS2015))
    4304             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4305             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4306             : #endif
    4307             : 
    4308             : #endif // _MSC_VER
    4309             : 
    4310             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4311             : // C++ language feature support
    4312             : 
    4313             : // catch all support for C++11
    4314             : #if defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201103L
    4315             : 
    4316             : #define CLARA_CPP11_OR_GREATER
    4317             : 
    4318             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR)
    4319             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4320             : #endif
    4321             : 
    4322             : #ifndef CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4323             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4324             : #endif
    4325             : 
    4326             : #ifndef CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4327             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4328             : #endif
    4329             : 
    4330             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE)
    4331             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    4332             : #endif
    4333             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR)
    4334             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4335             : #endif
    4336             : 
    4337             : #endif // __cplusplus >= 201103L
    4338             : 
    4339             : // Now set the actual defines based on the above + anything the user has configured
    4340             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4341             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4342             : #endif
    4343             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4344             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4345             : #endif
    4346             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4347             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4348             : #endif
    4349             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4350             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    4351             : #endif
    4352             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4353             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4354             : #endif
    4355             : 
    4356             : // noexcept support:
    4357             : #if defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_NOEXCEPT)
    4358             : #define CLARA_NOEXCEPT noexcept
    4359             : #  define CLARA_NOEXCEPT_IS(x) noexcept(x)
    4360             : #else
    4361             : #define CLARA_NOEXCEPT throw()
    4362             : #  define CLARA_NOEXCEPT_IS(x)
    4363             : #endif
    4364             : 
    4365             : // nullptr support
    4366             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4367             : #define CLARA_NULL nullptr
    4368             : #else
    4369             : #define CLARA_NULL NULL
    4370             : #endif
    4371             : 
    4372             : // override support
    4373             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    4374             : #define CLARA_OVERRIDE override
    4375             : #else
    4376             : #define CLARA_OVERRIDE
    4377             : #endif
    4378             : 
    4379             : // unique_ptr support
    4380             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4381             : #   define CLARA_AUTO_PTR( T ) std::unique_ptr<T>
    4382             : #else
    4383             : #   define CLARA_AUTO_PTR( T ) std::auto_ptr<T>
    4384             : #endif
    4385             : 
    4386             : #endif // TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    4387             : 
    4388             : // ----------- end of #include from clara_compilers.h -----------
    4389             : // ........... back in clara.h

    4445           1 :             _dest = _source;

    4447           0 :         char toLowerCh(char c) {
    4448           0 :             return static_cast<char>( std::tolower( c ) );
    4449             :         }
    4450           0 :         inline void convertInto( std::string const& _source, bool& _dest ) {
    4451           0 :             std::string sourceLC = _source;
    4452           0 :             std::transform( sourceLC.begin(), sourceLC.end(), sourceLC.begin(), toLowerCh );

    4454           0 :                 _dest = true;
    4455           0 :             else if( sourceLC == "n" || sourceLC == "0" || sourceLC == "false" || sourceLC == "no" || sourceLC == "off" )
    4456           0 :                 _dest = false;

    4578             : 
    4579             :     class Parser {

    4581             :         Mode mode;

    4586           0 :         struct Token {

    4592             :

    4594             : 
    4595           1 :         void parseIntoTokens( std::vector<std::string> const& args, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4596           2 :             const std::string doubleDash = "--";
    4597           1 :             for( std::size_t i = 1; i < args.size() && args[i] != doubleDash; ++i )
    4598           0 :                 parseIntoTokens( args[i], tokens);
    4599           1 :         }
    4600             : 
    4601           0 :         void parseIntoTokens( std::string const& arg, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4602           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < arg.size(); ++i ) {
    4603           0 :                 char c = arg[i];
    4604           0 :                 if( c == '"' )

    4622           0 :         Mode handleNone( std::size_t i, char c ) {
    4623           0 :             if( inQuotes ) {
    4624           0 :                 from = i;
    4625           0 :                 return Positional;

    4992           1 :         std::vector<Parser::Token> populateOptions( std::vector<Parser::Token> const& tokens, ConfigT& config ) const {
    4993           1 :             std::vector<Parser::Token> unusedTokens;

    4999           0 :                     Arg const& arg = *it;
    5000             : 
    5001             :                     try {
    5002           0 :                         if( ( token.type == Parser::Token::ShortOpt && arg.hasShortName( token.data ) ) ||
    5003           0 :                             ( token.type == Parser::Token::LongOpt && arg.hasLongName( token.data ) ) ) {

    5005           0 :                                 if( i == tokens.size()-1 || tokens[i+1].type != Parser::Token::Positional )
    5006           0 :                                     errors.push_back( "Expected argument to option: " + token.data );
    5007             :                                 else
    5008           0 :                                     arg.boundField.set( config, tokens[++i].data );
    5009             :                             }
    5010             :                             else {
    5011           0 :                                 arg.boundField.set( config, "true" );
    5012             :                             }
    5013           0 :                             break;
    5014             :                         }
    5015             :                     }
    5016           0 :                     catch( std::exception& ex ) {
    5017           0 :                         errors.push_back( std::string( ex.what() ) + "\n- while parsing: (" + arg.commands() + ")" );

    5019             :                 }

    5021           0 :                     if( token.type == Parser::Token::Positional || !m_throwOnUnrecognisedTokens )

    5023           0 :                     else if( errors.empty() && m_throwOnUnrecognisedTokens )
    5024           0 :                         errors.push_back( "unrecognised option: " + token.data );
    5025             :                 }

    5028           0 :                 std::ostringstream oss;
    5029           0 :                 for( std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator it = errors.begin(), itEnd = errors.end();
    5030             :                         it != itEnd;

    5032           0 :                     if( it != errors.begin() )

    5034           0 :                     oss << *it;

    5036           0 :                 throw std::runtime_error( oss.str() );
    5037             :             }
    5038           2 :             return unusedTokens;

    5069           1 :         void validate() const

    5342             :     struct TextAttributes {
    5343           0 :         TextAttributes()
    5344           0 :         :   initialIndent( std::string::npos ),
    5345             :             indent( 0 ),
    5346           0 :             width( consoleWidth-1 )
    5347           0 :         {}
    5348             : 
    5349           0 :         TextAttributes& setInitialIndent( std::size_t _value )  { initialIndent = _value; return *this; }
    5350           0 :         TextAttributes& setIndent( std::size_t _value )         { indent = _value; return *this; }
    5351           0 :         TextAttributes& setWidth( std::size_t _value )          { width = _value; return *this; }
    5352             : 
    5353             :         std::size_t initialIndent;  // indent of first line, or npos
    5354             :         std::size_t indent;         // indent of subsequent lines, or all if initialIndent is npos
    5355             :         std::size_t width;          // maximum width of text, including indent. Longer text will wrap
    5356             :     };
    5357             : 
    5358           0 :     class Text {
    5359             :     public:
    5360           0 :         Text( std::string const& _str, TextAttributes const& _attr = TextAttributes() )
    5361           0 :         : attr( _attr )
    5362             :         {
    5363           0 :             const std::string wrappableBeforeChars = "[({<\t";
    5364           0 :             const std::string wrappableAfterChars = "])}>-,./|\\";
    5365           0 :             const std::string wrappableInsteadOfChars = " \n\r";
    5366           0 :             std::string indent = _attr.initialIndent != std::string::npos
    5367           0 :                 ? std::string( _attr.initialIndent, ' ' )
    5368           0 :                 : std::string( _attr.indent, ' ' );
    5369             : 
    5370             :             typedef std::string::const_iterator iterator;
    5371           0 :             iterator it = _str.begin();
    5372           0 :             const iterator strEnd = _str.end();
    5373             : 
    5374           0 :             while( it != strEnd ) {
    5375             : 
    5376           0 :                 if( lines.size() >= 1000 ) {
    5377           0 :                     lines.push_back( "... message truncated due to excessive size" );
    5378           0 :                     return;
    5379             :                 }
    5380             : 
    5381           0 :                 std::string suffix;
    5382           0 :                 std::size_t width = (std::min)( static_cast<size_t>( strEnd-it ), _attr.width-static_cast<size_t>( indent.size() ) );
    5383           0 :                 iterator itEnd = it+width;
    5384           0 :                 iterator itNext = _str.end();
    5385             : 
    5386           0 :                 iterator itNewLine = std::find( it, itEnd, '\n' );
    5387           0 :                 if( itNewLine != itEnd )
    5388           0 :                     itEnd = itNewLine;
    5389             : 
    5390           0 :                 if( itEnd != strEnd  ) {
    5391           0 :                     bool foundWrapPoint = false;
    5392           0 :                     iterator findIt = itEnd;
    5393           0 :                     do {
    5394           0 :                         if( wrappableAfterChars.find( *findIt ) != std::string::npos && findIt != itEnd ) {
    5395           0 :                             itEnd = findIt+1;
    5396           0 :                             itNext = findIt+1;
    5397           0 :                             foundWrapPoint = true;
    5398             :                         }
    5399           0 :                         else if( findIt > it && wrappableBeforeChars.find( *findIt ) != std::string::npos ) {
    5400           0 :                             itEnd = findIt;
    5401           0 :                             itNext = findIt;
    5402           0 :                             foundWrapPoint = true;
    5403             :                         }
    5404           0 :                         else if( wrappableInsteadOfChars.find( *findIt ) != std::string::npos ) {
    5405           0 :                             itNext = findIt+1;
    5406           0 :                             itEnd = findIt;
    5407           0 :                             foundWrapPoint = true;
    5408             :                         }
    5409           0 :                         if( findIt == it )
    5410           0 :                             break;
    5411             :                         else
    5412           0 :                             --findIt;
    5413             :                     }
    5414           0 :                     while( !foundWrapPoint );
    5415             : 
    5416           0 :                     if( !foundWrapPoint ) {
    5417             :                         // No good wrap char, so we'll break mid word and add a hyphen
    5418           0 :                         --itEnd;
    5419           0 :                         itNext = itEnd;
    5420           0 :                         suffix = "-";
    5421             :                     }
    5422             :                     else {
    5423           0 :                         while( itEnd > it && wrappableInsteadOfChars.find( *(itEnd-1) ) != std::string::npos )
    5424           0 :                             --itEnd;
    5425             :                     }
    5426             :                 }
    5427           0 :                 lines.push_back( indent + std::string( it, itEnd ) + suffix );
    5428             : 
    5429           0 :                 if( indent.size() != _attr.indent )
    5430           0 :                     indent = std::string( _attr.indent, ' ' );
    5431           0 :                 it = itNext;
    5432             :             }
    5433             :         }
    5434             : 
    5435             :         typedef std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator const_iterator;

    5437           0 :         const_iterator begin() const { return lines.begin(); }
    5438           0 :         const_iterator end() const { return lines.end(); }

    5445             :             return oss.str();
    5446             :         }

    5516             :             Headers = White

    5526             :

    5566             :

    5572          13 :             used = false;

    5796           0 :     inline std::size_t listTests( Config const& config ) {
    5797             : 
    5798           0 :         TestSpec testSpec = config.testSpec();
    5799           0 :         if( config.testSpec().hasFilters() )
    5800           0 :             Catch::cout() << "Matching test cases:\n";
    5801             :         else {
    5802           0 :             Catch::cout() << "All available test cases:\n";
    5803           0 :             testSpec = TestSpecParser( ITagAliasRegistry::get() ).parse( "*" ).testSpec();
    5804             :         }
    5805             : 
    5806           0 :         std::size_t matchedTests = 0;
    5807           0 :         TextAttributes nameAttr, tagsAttr;
    5808           0 :         nameAttr.setInitialIndent( 2 ).setIndent( 4 );
    5809           0 :         tagsAttr.setIndent( 6 );
    5810             : 
    5811           0 :         std::vector<TestCase> matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );

    5813             :                 it != itEnd;
    5814             :                 ++it ) {

    5816           0 :             TestCaseInfo const& testCaseInfo = it->getTestCaseInfo();

    5818           0 :                 ? Colour::SecondaryText
    5819           0 :                 : Colour::None;
    5820           0 :             Colour colourGuard( colour );

    5823           0 :             if( !testCaseInfo.tags.empty() )
    5824           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Text( testCaseInfo.tagsAsString, tagsAttr ) << std::endl;
    5825             :         }
    5826             : 
    5827           0 :         if( !config.testSpec().hasFilters() )

    5829             :         else
    5830           0 :             Catch::cout() << pluralise( matchedTests, "matching test case" ) << '\n' << std::endl;

    5832             :     }

    6044          11 :         void completeCycle() {

    6364             : namespace Catch {
    6365             : 
    6366             :     struct SignalDefs { DWORD id; const char* name; };
    6367             :     extern SignalDefs signalDefs[];
    6368             :     // There is no 1-1 mapping between signals and windows exceptions.
    6369             :     // Windows can easily distinguish between SO and SigSegV,
    6370             :     // but SigInt, SigTerm, etc are handled differently.
    6371             :     SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
    6372             :         { EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
    6373             :         { EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW, "SIGSEGV - Stack overflow" },
    6374             :         { EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
    6375             :         { EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO, "Divide by zero error" },
    6376             :     };
    6377             : 
    6378             :     struct FatalConditionHandler {
    6379             : 
    6380             :         static LONG CALLBACK handleVectoredException(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS ExceptionInfo) {
    6381             :             for (int i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs) / sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
    6382             :                 if (ExceptionInfo->ExceptionRecord->ExceptionCode == signalDefs[i].id) {
    6383             :                     reportFatal(signalDefs[i].name);
    6384             :                 }
    6385             :             }
    6386             :             // If its not an exception we care about, pass it along.
    6387             :             // This stops us from eating debugger breaks etc.
    6388             :             return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
    6389             :         }
    6390             : 
    6391             :         FatalConditionHandler() {
    6392             :             isSet = true;
    6393             :             // 32k seems enough for Catch to handle stack overflow,
    6394             :             // but the value was found experimentally, so there is no strong guarantee
    6395             :             guaranteeSize = 32 * 1024;
    6396             :             exceptionHandlerHandle = CATCH_NULL;
    6397             :             // Register as first handler in current chain
    6398             :             exceptionHandlerHandle = AddVectoredExceptionHandler(1, handleVectoredException);
    6399             :             // Pass in guarantee size to be filled
    6400             :             SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
    6401             :         }
    6402             : 
    6403             :         static void reset() {
    6404             :             if (isSet) {
    6405             :                 // Unregister handler and restore the old guarantee
    6406             :                 RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler(exceptionHandlerHandle);
    6407             :                 SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
    6408             :                 exceptionHandlerHandle = CATCH_NULL;
    6409             :                 isSet = false;
    6410             :             }
    6411             :         }
    6412             : 
    6413             :         ~FatalConditionHandler() {
    6414             :             reset();
    6415             :         }
    6416             :     private:
    6417             :         static bool isSet;
    6418             :         static ULONG guaranteeSize;
    6419             :         static PVOID exceptionHandlerHandle;
    6420             :     };
    6421             : 
    6422             :     bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;

    6447             :         int id;
    6448             :         const char* name;
    6449             :     };
    6450             :     extern SignalDefs signalDefs[];
    6451             :     SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
    6452             :             { SIGINT,  "SIGINT - Terminal interrupt signal" },
    6453             :             { SIGILL,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
    6454             :             { SIGFPE,  "SIGFPE - Floating point error signal" },
    6455             :             { SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
    6456             :             { SIGTERM, "SIGTERM - Termination request signal" },
    6457             :             { SIGABRT, "SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal" }
    6458             :     };
    6459             : 
    6460             :     struct FatalConditionHandler {
    6461             : 
    6462             :         static bool isSet;
    6463             :         static struct sigaction oldSigActions [sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs)];
    6464             :         static stack_t oldSigStack;
    6465             :         static char altStackMem[SIGSTKSZ];
    6466             : 
    6467           0 :         static void handleSignal( int sig ) {
    6468           0 :             std::string name = "<unknown signal>";
    6469           0 :             for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs) / sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
    6470           0 :                 SignalDefs &def = signalDefs[i];
    6471           0 :                 if (sig == def.id) {
    6472           0 :                     name = def.name;
    6473           0 :                     break;
    6474             :                 }
    6475             :             }
    6476           0 :             reset();
    6477           0 :             reportFatal(name);
    6478           0 :             raise( sig );
    6479           0 :         }
    6480             : 
    6481          11 :         FatalConditionHandler() {
    6482          11 :             isSet = true;
    6483             :             stack_t sigStack;
    6484          11 :             sigStack.ss_sp = altStackMem;
    6485          11 :             sigStack.ss_size = SIGSTKSZ;
    6486          11 :             sigStack.ss_flags = 0;
    6487          11 :             sigaltstack(&sigStack, &oldSigStack);
    6488          11 :             struct sigaction sa = { 0 };
    6489             : 
    6490          11 :             sa.sa_handler = handleSignal;
    6491          11 :             sa.sa_flags = SA_ONSTACK;
    6492          77 :             for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
    6493          66 :                 sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &sa, &oldSigActions[i]);
    6494             :             }
    6495          11 :         }
    6496             : 
    6497          11 :         ~FatalConditionHandler() {
    6498          11 :             reset();
    6499          11 :         }
    6500          22 :         static void reset() {
    6501          22 :             if( isSet ) {
    6502             :                 // Set signals back to previous values -- hopefully nobody overwrote them in the meantime
    6503          77 :                 for( std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i ) {
    6504          66 :                     sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &oldSigActions[i], CATCH_NULL);
    6505             :                 }
    6506             :                 // Return the old stack
    6507          11 :                 sigaltstack(&oldSigStack, CATCH_NULL);
    6508          11 :                 isSet = false;
    6509             :             }
    6510          22 :         }
    6511             :     };

    7531             :     class StreamBufImpl : public StreamBufBase {
    7532             :         char data[bufferSize];
    7533             :         WriterF m_writer;
    7534             : 
    7535             :     public:
    7536           0 :         StreamBufImpl() {
    7537           0 :             setp( data, data + sizeof(data) );
    7538           0 :         }
    7539             : 
    7540           0 :         ~StreamBufImpl() CATCH_NOEXCEPT {
    7541           0 :             sync();
    7542           0 :         }
    7543             : 
    7544             :     private:
    7545           0 :         int overflow( int c ) {
    7546           0 :             sync();
    7547             : 
    7548           0 :             if( c != EOF ) {
    7549           0 :                 if( pbase() == epptr() )
    7550           0 :                     m_writer( std::string( 1, static_cast<char>( c ) ) );
    7551             :                 else
    7552           0 :                     sputc( static_cast<char>( c ) );
    7553             :             }
    7554           0 :             return 0;
    7555             :         }
    7556             : 
    7557           0 :         int sync() {
    7558           0 :             if( pbase() != pptr() ) {
    7559           0 :                 m_writer( std::string( pbase(), static_cast<std::string::size_type>( pptr() - pbase() ) ) );
    7560           0 :                 setp( pbase(), epptr() );
    7561             :             }
    7562           0 :             return 0;
    7563             :         }
    7564             :     };

    8074           0 :     inline TestCaseInfo::SpecialProperties parseSpecialTag( std::string const& tag ) {
    8075           0 :         if( startsWith( tag, '.' ) ||
    8076           0 :             tag == "hide" ||
    8077           0 :             tag == "!hide" )
    8078           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::IsHidden;
    8079           0 :         else if( tag == "!throws" )
    8080           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::Throws;
    8081           0 :         else if( tag == "!shouldfail" )
    8082           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::ShouldFail;
    8083           0 :         else if( tag == "!mayfail" )
    8084           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::MayFail;
    8085           0 :         else if( tag == "!nonportable" )
    8086           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::NonPortable;
    8087             :         else
    8088           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::None;
    8089             :     }
    8090           0 :     inline bool isReservedTag( std::string const& tag ) {
    8091           0 :         return parseSpecialTag( tag ) == TestCaseInfo::None && tag.size() > 0 && !std::isalnum( tag[0] );
    8092             :     }
    8093           0 :     inline void enforceNotReservedTag( std::string const& tag, SourceLineInfo const& _lineInfo ) {
    8094           0 :         if( isReservedTag( tag ) ) {
    8095           0 :             std::ostringstream ss;
    8096           0 :             ss << Colour(Colour::Red)
    8097             :                << "Tag name [" << tag << "] not allowed.\n"
    8098           0 :                << "Tag names starting with non alpha-numeric characters are reserved\n"
    8099           0 :                << Colour(Colour::FileName)
    8100           0 :                << _lineInfo << '\n';
    8101           0 :             throw std::runtime_error(ss.str());
    8102             :         }
    8103           0 :     }
    8104             : 
    8105          11 :     TestCase makeTestCase(  ITestCase* _testCase,
    8106             :                             std::string const& _className,
    8107             :                             std::string const& _name,
    8108             :                             std::string const& _descOrTags,
    8109             :                             SourceLineInfo const& _lineInfo )
    8110             :     {
    8111          11 :         bool isHidden( startsWith( _name, "./" ) ); // Legacy support
    8112             : 
    8113             :         // Parse out tags
    8114          22 :         std::set<std::string> tags;
    8115          22 :         std::string desc, tag;
    8116          11 :         bool inTag = false;
    8117          11 :         for( std::size_t i = 0; i < _descOrTags.size(); ++i ) {
    8118           0 :             char c = _descOrTags[i];
    8119           0 :             if( !inTag ) {
    8120           0 :                 if( c == '[' )
    8121           0 :                     inTag = true;
    8122             :                 else
    8123           0 :                     desc += c;
    8124             :             }
    8125             :             else {
    8126           0 :                 if( c == ']' ) {
    8127           0 :                     TestCaseInfo::SpecialProperties prop = parseSpecialTag( tag );
    8128           0 :                     if( prop == TestCaseInfo::IsHidden )
    8129           0 :                         isHidden = true;
    8130           0 :                     else if( prop == TestCaseInfo::None )
    8131           0 :                         enforceNotReservedTag( tag, _lineInfo );
    8132             : 
    8133           0 :                     tags.insert( tag );
    8134           0 :                     tag.clear();
    8135           0 :                     inTag = false;
    8136             :                 }
    8137             :                 else
    8138           0 :                     tag += c;
    8139             :             }
    8140             :         }
    8141          11 :         if( isHidden ) {
    8142           0 :             tags.insert( "hide" );
    8143           0 :             tags.insert( "." );

    8471             :         UInt64 getCurrentTicks() {
    8472             :             static UInt64 hz=0, hzo=0;
    8473             :             if (!hz) {
    8474             :                 QueryPerformanceFrequency( reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>( &hz ) );
    8475             :                 QueryPerformanceCounter( reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>( &hzo ) );
    8476             :             }
    8477             :             UInt64 t;
    8478             :             QueryPerformanceCounter( reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>( &t ) );
    8479             :             return ((t-hzo)*1000000)/hz;
    8480             :         }
    8481             : #else
    8482          22 :         UInt64 getCurrentTicks() {
    8483             :             timeval t;
    8484          22 :             gettimeofday(&t,CATCH_NULL);
    8485          22 :             return static_cast<UInt64>( t.tv_sec ) * 1000000ull + static_cast<UInt64>( t.tv_usec );
    8486             :         }
    8487             : #endif
    8488             :     }
    8489             :

    8544           0 :         std::string::size_type start = str.find_first_not_of( whitespaceChars );
    8545           0 :         std::string::size_type end = str.find_last_not_of( whitespaceChars );
    8546             : 
    8547           0 :         return start != std::string::npos ? str.substr( start, 1+end-start ) : std::string();
    8548             :     }
    8549             : 
    8550           0 :     bool replaceInPlace( std::string& str, std::string const& replaceThis, std::string const& withThis ) {
    8551           0 :         bool replaced = false;
    8552           0 :         std::size_t i = str.find( replaceThis );
    8553           0 :         while( i != std::string::npos ) {
    8554           0 :             replaced = true;
    8555           0 :             str = str.substr( 0, i ) + withThis + str.substr( i+replaceThis.size() );
    8556           0 :             if( i < str.size()-withThis.size() )
    8557           0 :                 i = str.find( replaceThis, i+withThis.size() );
    8558             :             else
    8559           0 :                 i = std::string::npos;
    8560             :         }
    8561           0 :         return replaced;
    8562             :     }

    8639           0 :             SectionEndInfo endInfo( m_info, m_assertions, m_timer.getElapsedSeconds() );
    8640           0 :             if( std::uncaught_exception() )
    8641           0 :                 getResultCapture().sectionEndedEarly( endInfo );
    8642             :             else
    8643           0 :                 getResultCapture().sectionEnded( endInfo );
    8644             :         }
    8645           0 :     }
    8646             : 
    8647             :     // This indicates whether the section should be executed or not
    8648           0 :     Section::operator bool() const {
    8649           0 :         return m_sectionIncluded;
    8650             :     }
    8651             : 
    8652             : } // end namespace Catch
    8653             : 
    8654             : // #included from: catch_debugger.hpp
    8655             : #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_DEBUGGER_HPP_INCLUDED
    8656             : 
    8657             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
    8658             : 
    8659             :     #include <assert.h>
    8660             :     #include <stdbool.h>
    8661             :     #include <sys/types.h>
    8662             :     #include <unistd.h>
    8663             :     #include <sys/sysctl.h>
    8664             : 
    8665             :     namespace Catch{
    8666             : 
    8667             :         // The following function is taken directly from the following technical note:
    8668             :         // http://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#qa/qa2004/qa1361.html
    8669             : 
    8670             :         // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
    8671             :         // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
    8672             :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    8673             : 
    8674             :             int                 mib[4];
    8675             :             struct kinfo_proc   info;
    8676             :             size_t              size;
    8677             : 
    8678             :             // Initialize the flags so that, if sysctl fails for some bizarre
    8679             :             // reason, we get a predictable result.
    8680             : 
    8681             :             info.kp_proc.p_flag = 0;
    8682             : 
    8683             :             // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl the info we want, in this case
    8684             :             // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
    8685             : 
    8686             :             mib[0] = CTL_KERN;
    8687             :             mib[1] = KERN_PROC;
    8688             :             mib[2] = KERN_PROC_PID;
    8689             :             mib[3] = getpid();
    8690             : 
    8691             :             // Call sysctl.
    8692             : 
    8693             :             size = sizeof(info);
    8694             :             if( sysctl(mib, sizeof(mib) / sizeof(*mib), &info, &size, CATCH_NULL, 0) != 0 ) {
    8695             :                 Catch::cerr() << "\n** Call to sysctl failed - unable to determine if debugger is active **\n" << std::endl;
    8696             :                 return false;
    8697             :             }
    8698             : 
    8699             :             // We're being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
    8700             : 
    8701             :             return ( (info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED) != 0 );
    8702             :         }
    8703             :     } // namespace Catch
    8704             : 
    8705             : #elif defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX)
    8706             :     #include <fstream>
    8707             :     #include <string>
    8708             : 
    8709             :     namespace Catch{
    8710             :         // The standard POSIX way of detecting a debugger is to attempt to
    8711             :         // ptrace() the process, but this needs to be done from a child and not
    8712             :         // this process itself to still allow attaching to this process later
    8713             :         // if wanted, so is rather heavy. Under Linux we have the PID of the
    8714             :         // "debugger" (which doesn't need to be gdb, of course, it could also
    8715             :         // be strace, for example) in /proc/$PID/status, so just get it from
    8716             :         // there instead.
    8717           1 :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    8718             :             // Libstdc++ has a bug, where std::ifstream sets errno to 0
    8719             :             // This way our users can properly assert over errno values
    8720           2 :             ErrnoGuard guard;
    8721           2 :             std::ifstream in("/proc/self/status");
    8722           8 :             for( std::string line; std::getline(in, line); ) {
    8723             :                 static const int PREFIX_LEN = 11;
    8724           8 :                 if( line.compare(0, PREFIX_LEN, "TracerPid:\t") == 0 ) {
    8725             :                     // We're traced if the PID is not 0 and no other PID starts
    8726             :                     // with 0 digit, so it's enough to check for just a single
    8727             :                     // character.
    8728           1 :                     return line.length() > PREFIX_LEN && line[PREFIX_LEN] != '0';
    8729             :                 }
    8730             :             }
    8731             : 
    8732           0 :             return false;
    8733             :         }
    8734             :     } // namespace Catch
    8735             : #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
    8736             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    8737             :     namespace Catch {
    8738             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    8739             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    8740             :         }
    8741             :     }
    8742             : #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
    8743             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    8744             :     namespace Catch {
    8745             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    8746             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    8747             :         }
    8748             :     }
    8749             : #else
    8750             :     namespace Catch {
    8751             :        inline bool isDebuggerActive() { return false; }
    8752             :     }
    8753             : #endif // Platform
    8754             : 
    8755             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
    8756             : 
    8757             :     namespace Catch {
    8758             :         void writeToDebugConsole( std::string const& text ) {
    8759             :             ::OutputDebugStringA( text.c_str() );
    8760             :         }
    8761             :     }
    8762             : #else
    8763             :     namespace Catch {
    8764           0 :         void writeToDebugConsole( std::string const& text ) {

    8775             :

    8777             : 
    8778           1 :     const std::string unprintableString = "{?}";
    8779             : 
    8780             :     namespace {
    8781             :         const int hexThreshold = 255;
    8782             : 
    8783             :         struct Endianness {
    8784             :             enum Arch { Big, Little };
    8785             : 
    8786           0 :             static Arch which() {
    8787             :                 union _{
    8788             :                     int asInt;
    8789             :                     char asChar[sizeof (int)];
    8790             :                 } u;
    8791             : 
    8792           0 :                 u.asInt = 1;
    8793           0 :                 return ( u.asChar[sizeof(int)-1] == 1 ) ? Big : Little;
    8794             :             }
    8795             :         };
    8796             :     }
    8797             : 
    8798           0 :     std::string rawMemoryToString( const void *object, std::size_t size )
    8799             :     {
    8800             :         // Reverse order for little endian architectures
    8801           0 :         int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>( size ), inc = 1;
    8802           0 :         if( Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little ) {
    8803           0 :             i = end-1;
    8804           0 :             end = inc = -1;
    8805             :         }
    8806             : 
    8807           0 :         unsigned char const *bytes = static_cast<unsigned char const *>(object);
    8808           0 :         std::ostringstream os;
    8809           0 :         os << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
    8810           0 :         for( ; i != end; i += inc )
    8811           0 :              os << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
    8812           0 :        return os.str();
    8813             :     }
    8814             : }
    8815             : 
    8816           0 : std::string toString( std::string const& value ) {

    8819           0 :         for(size_t i = 0; i < s.size(); ++i ) {
    8820           0 :             std::string subs;

    8822           0 :             case '\n': subs = "\\n"; break;
    8823           0 :             case '\t': subs = "\\t"; break;
    8824           0 :             default: break;
    8825             :             }

    8827           0 :                 s = s.substr( 0, i ) + subs + s.substr( i+1 );

    8829             :             }
    8830             :         }
    8831             :     }
    8832           0 :     return '"' + s + '"';

    9071             :         if (m_shouldDebugBreak) {
    9072             :             ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    9073             :             // To inspect the state during test, you need to go one level up the callstack
    9074             :             // To go back to the test and change execution, jump over the throw statement
    9075             :             ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    9076             :             CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER();
    9077             :         }
    9078             : #endif
    9079          23 :         if( m_shouldThrow )
    9080           0 :             throw Catch::TestFailureException();
    9081          23 :     }
    9082             :

    9086           0 :     AssertionResult ResultBuilder::build() const
    9087             :     {
    9088           0 :         return build( *this );
    9089             :     }
    9090             : 
    9091             :     // CAVEAT: The returned AssertionResult stores a pointer to the argument expr,
    9092             :     //         a temporary DecomposedExpression, which in turn holds references to
    9093             :     //         operands, possibly temporary as well.
    9094             :     //         It should immediately be passed to handleResult; if the expression
    9095             :     //         needs to be reported, its string expansion must be composed before
    9096             :     //         the temporaries are destroyed.
    9097          23 :     AssertionResult ResultBuilder::build( DecomposedExpression const& expr ) const
    9098             :     {
    9099          23 :         assert( m_data.resultType != ResultWas::Unknown );
    9100          46 :         AssertionResultData data = m_data;
    9101             : 
    9102             :         // Flip bool results if FalseTest flag is set
    9103          23 :         if( isFalseTest( m_assertionInfo.resultDisposition ) ) {
    9104           0 :             data.negate( expr.isBinaryExpression() );
    9105             :         }
    9106             : 
    9107          23 :         data.message = m_stream.oss.str();
    9108          23 :         data.decomposedExpression = &expr; // for lazy reconstruction
    9109          46 :         return AssertionResult( m_assertionInfo, data );
    9110             :     }

    9139             : 
    9140           1 :     std::string TagAliasRegistry::expandAliases( std::string const& unexpandedTestSpec ) const {
    9141           1 :         std::string expandedTestSpec = unexpandedTestSpec;
    9142           1 :         for( std::map<std::string, TagAlias>::const_iterator it = m_registry.begin(), itEnd = m_registry.end();
    9143             :                 it != itEnd;
    9144             :                 ++it ) {
    9145           0 :             std::size_t pos = expandedTestSpec.find( it->first );
    9146           0 :             if( pos != std::string::npos ) {
    9147           0 :                 expandedTestSpec =  expandedTestSpec.substr( 0, pos ) +
    9148           0 :                                     it->second.tag +
    9149           0 :                                     expandedTestSpec.substr( pos + it->first.size() );
    9150             :             }
    9151             :         }
    9152           1 :         return expandedTestSpec;
    9153             :     }
    9154             :

    9418             :     namespace {
    9419             :         // Because formatting using c++ streams is stateful, drop down to C is required
    9420             :         // Alternatively we could use stringstream, but its performance is... not good.
    9421           0 :         std::string getFormattedDuration( double duration ) {
    9422             :             // Max exponent + 1 is required to represent the whole part
    9423             :             // + 1 for decimal point
    9424             :             // + 3 for the 3 decimal places
    9425             :             // + 1 for null terminator
    9426           0 :             const size_t maxDoubleSize = DBL_MAX_10_EXP + 1 + 1 + 3 + 1;
    9427             :             char buffer[maxDoubleSize];
    9428             : 
    9429             :             // Save previous errno, to prevent sprintf from overwriting it
    9430           0 :             ErrnoGuard guard;
    9431             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
    9432             :             sprintf_s(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
    9433             : #else
    9434           0 :             sprintf(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
    9435             : #endif
    9436           0 :             return std::string(buffer);
    9437             :         }
    9438             :     }

    9502             :     struct CumulativeReporterBase : SharedImpl<IStreamingReporter> {
    9503             :         template<typename T, typename ChildNodeT>
    9504             :         struct Node : SharedImpl<> {
    9505           0 :             explicit Node( T const& _value ) : value( _value ) {}
    9506           0 :             virtual ~Node() {}
    9507             : 
    9508             :             typedef std::vector<Ptr<ChildNodeT> > ChildNodes;
    9509             :             T value;
    9510             :             ChildNodes children;
    9511             :         };
    9512             :         struct SectionNode : SharedImpl<> {
    9513           0 :             explicit SectionNode( SectionStats const& _stats ) : stats( _stats ) {}
    9514             :             virtual ~SectionNode();
    9515             : 
    9516             :             bool operator == ( SectionNode const& other ) const {
    9517             :                 return stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo == other.stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo;
    9518             :             }
    9519             :             bool operator == ( Ptr<SectionNode> const& other ) const {
    9520             :                 return operator==( *other );
    9521             :             }
    9522             : 
    9523             :             SectionStats stats;
    9524             :             typedef std::vector<Ptr<SectionNode> > ChildSections;
    9525             :             typedef std::vector<AssertionStats> Assertions;
    9526             :             ChildSections childSections;
    9527             :             Assertions assertions;
    9528             :             std::string stdOut;
    9529             :             std::string stdErr;
    9530             :         };
    9531             : 
    9532             :         struct BySectionInfo {
    9533           0 :             BySectionInfo( SectionInfo const& other ) : m_other( other ) {}
    9534           0 :             BySectionInfo( BySectionInfo const& other ) : m_other( other.m_other ) {}
    9535           0 :             bool operator() ( Ptr<SectionNode> const& node ) const {
    9536           0 :                 return node->stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo == m_other.lineInfo;
    9537             :             }
    9538             :         private:
    9539             :             void operator=( BySectionInfo const& );
    9540             :             SectionInfo const& m_other;
    9541             :         };
    9542             : 
    9543             :         typedef Node<TestCaseStats, SectionNode> TestCaseNode;
    9544             :         typedef Node<TestGroupStats, TestCaseNode> TestGroupNode;
    9545             :         typedef Node<TestRunStats, TestGroupNode> TestRunNode;
    9546             : 
    9547           0 :         CumulativeReporterBase( ReporterConfig const& _config )

    9549           0 :             stream( _config.stream() )

    9557             :         }
    9558             : 
    9559           0 :         virtual void testRunStarting( TestRunInfo const& ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {}
    9560           0 :         virtual void testGroupStarting( GroupInfo const& ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {}
    9561             : 
    9562           0 :         virtual void testCaseStarting( TestCaseInfo const& ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {}
    9563             : 
    9564           0 :         virtual void sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9565           0 :             SectionStats incompleteStats( sectionInfo, Counts(), 0, false );
    9566           0 :             Ptr<SectionNode> node;
    9567           0 :             if( m_sectionStack.empty() ) {
    9568           0 :                 if( !m_rootSection )
    9569           0 :                     m_rootSection = new SectionNode( incompleteStats );
    9570           0 :                 node = m_rootSection;
    9571             :             }
    9572             :             else {
    9573           0 :                 SectionNode& parentNode = *m_sectionStack.back();
    9574             :                 SectionNode::ChildSections::const_iterator it =
    9575           0 :                     std::find_if(   parentNode.childSections.begin(),
    9576             :                                     parentNode.childSections.end(),
    9577           0 :                                     BySectionInfo( sectionInfo ) );
    9578           0 :                 if( it == parentNode.childSections.end() ) {
    9579           0 :                     node = new SectionNode( incompleteStats );
    9580           0 :                     parentNode.childSections.push_back( node );
    9581             :                 }
    9582             :                 else
    9583           0 :                     node = *it;
    9584             :             }
    9585           0 :             m_sectionStack.push_back( node );
    9586           0 :             m_deepestSection = node;
    9587           0 :         }
    9588             : 
    9589           0 :         virtual void assertionStarting( AssertionInfo const& ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {}
    9590             : 
    9591           0 :         virtual bool assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9592           0 :             assert( !m_sectionStack.empty() );
    9593           0 :             SectionNode& sectionNode = *m_sectionStack.back();
    9594           0 :             sectionNode.assertions.push_back( assertionStats );
    9595             :             // AssertionResult holds a pointer to a temporary DecomposedExpression,
    9596             :             // which getExpandedExpression() calls to build the expression string.
    9597             :             // Our section stack copy of the assertionResult will likely outlive the
    9598             :             // temporary, so it must be expanded or discarded now to avoid calling
    9599             :             // a destroyed object later.
    9600           0 :             prepareExpandedExpression( sectionNode.assertions.back().assertionResult );
    9601           0 :             return true;
    9602             :         }
    9603           0 :         virtual void sectionEnded( SectionStats const& sectionStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9604           0 :             assert( !m_sectionStack.empty() );
    9605           0 :             SectionNode& node = *m_sectionStack.back();
    9606           0 :             node.stats = sectionStats;
    9607           0 :             m_sectionStack.pop_back();
    9608           0 :         }
    9609           0 :         virtual void testCaseEnded( TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9610           0 :             Ptr<TestCaseNode> node = new TestCaseNode( testCaseStats );
    9611           0 :             assert( m_sectionStack.size() == 0 );
    9612           0 :             node->children.push_back( m_rootSection );
    9613           0 :             m_testCases.push_back( node );
    9614           0 :             m_rootSection.reset();
    9615             : 
    9616           0 :             assert( m_deepestSection );
    9617           0 :             m_deepestSection->stdOut = testCaseStats.stdOut;
    9618           0 :             m_deepestSection->stdErr = testCaseStats.stdErr;
    9619           0 :         }
    9620           0 :         virtual void testGroupEnded( TestGroupStats const& testGroupStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9621           0 :             Ptr<TestGroupNode> node = new TestGroupNode( testGroupStats );
    9622           0 :             node->children.swap( m_testCases );
    9623           0 :             m_testGroups.push_back( node );
    9624           0 :         }

    9626           0 :             Ptr<TestRunNode> node = new TestRunNode( testRunStats );

    9705             : 
    9706             :     template<typename T>
    9707             :     class ReporterRegistrar {
    9708             : 
    9709          12 :         class ReporterFactory : public SharedImpl<IReporterFactory> {
    9710             : 
    9711             :             // *** Please Note ***:
    9712             :             // - If you end up here looking at a compiler error because it's trying to register
    9713             :             // your custom reporter class be aware that the native reporter interface has changed
    9714             :             // to IStreamingReporter. The "legacy" interface, IReporter, is still supported via
    9715             :             // an adapter. Just use REGISTER_LEGACY_REPORTER to take advantage of the adapter.
    9716             :             // However please consider updating to the new interface as the old one is now
    9717             :             // deprecated and will probably be removed quite soon!
    9718             :             // Please contact me via github if you have any questions at all about this.
    9719             :             // In fact, ideally, please contact me anyway to let me know you've hit this - as I have
    9720             :             // no idea who is actually using custom reporters at all (possibly no-one!).
    9721             :             // The new interface is designed to minimise exposure to interface changes in the future.
    9722           1 :             virtual IStreamingReporter* create( ReporterConfig const& config ) const {
    9723           1 :                 return new T( config );
    9724             :             }
    9725             : 
    9726           0 :             virtual std::string getDescription() const {
    9727           0 :                 return T::getDescription();
    9728             :             }
    9729             :         };
    9730             : 
    9731             :     public:
    9732             : 
    9733           4 :         ReporterRegistrar( std::string const& name ) {
    9734           4 :             getMutableRegistryHub().registerReporter( name, new ReporterFactory() );
    9735           4 :         }
    9736             :     };
    9737             :

    9782           0 :     class XmlEncode {
    9783             :     public:
    9784             :         enum ForWhat { ForTextNodes, ForAttributes };
    9785             : 
    9786           0 :         XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat = ForTextNodes )
    9787           0 :         :   m_str( str ),
    9788           0 :             m_forWhat( forWhat )
    9789           0 :         {}
    9790             : 
    9791           0 :         void encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
    9792             : 
    9793             :             // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
    9794             :             // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
    9795             : 
    9796           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < m_str.size(); ++ i ) {
    9797           0 :                 char c = m_str[i];
    9798           0 :                 switch( c ) {
    9799           0 :                     case '<':   os << "&lt;"; break;
    9800           0 :                     case '&':   os << "&amp;"; break;
    9801             : 
    9802             :                     case '>':
    9803             :                         // See: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
    9804           0 :                         if( i > 2 && m_str[i-1] == ']' && m_str[i-2] == ']' )
    9805           0 :                             os << "&gt;";
    9806             :                         else
    9807           0 :                             os << c;
    9808           0 :                         break;
    9809             : 
    9810             :                     case '\"':
    9811           0 :                         if( m_forWhat == ForAttributes )
    9812           0 :                             os << "&quot;";
    9813             :                         else
    9814           0 :                             os << c;
    9815           0 :                         break;
    9816             : 
    9817             :                     default:
    9818             :                         // Escape control chars - based on contribution by @espenalb in PR #465 and
    9819             :                         // by @mrpi PR #588
    9820           0 :                         if ( ( c >= 0 && c < '\x09' ) || ( c > '\x0D' && c < '\x20') || c=='\x7F' ) {
    9821             :                             // see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
    9822           0 :                             os << "\\x" << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
    9823           0 :                                << static_cast<int>( c );
    9824             :                         }
    9825             :                         else
    9826           0 :                             os << c;
    9827             :                 }
    9828             :             }
    9829           0 :         }
    9830             : 
    9831           0 :         friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
    9832           0 :             xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
    9833           0 :             return os;
    9834             :         }
    9835             : 
    9836             :     private:
    9837             :         std::string m_str;
    9838             :         ForWhat m_forWhat;
    9839             :     };
    9840             :

    9842             :     public:
    9843             :

    9910             :         }
    9911             : 
    9912           0 :         XmlWriter& endElement() {
    9913           0 :             newlineIfNecessary();

    9915           0 :             if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
    9916           0 :                 m_os << "/>";
    9917           0 :                 m_tagIsOpen = false;
    9918             :             }
    9919             :             else {
    9920           0 :                 m_os << m_indent << "</" << m_tags.back() << ">";
    9921             :             }
    9922           0 :             m_os << std::endl;
    9923           0 :             m_tags.pop_back();
    9924           0 :             return *this;
    9925             :         }
    9926             : 
    9927           0 :         XmlWriter& writeAttribute( std::string const& name, std::string const& attribute ) {

    9929           0 :                 m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << XmlEncode( attribute, XmlEncode::ForAttributes ) << '"';
    9930           0 :             return *this;
    9931             :         }
    9932             : 
    9933           0 :         XmlWriter& writeAttribute( std::string const& name, bool attribute ) {
    9934           0 :             m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << ( attribute ? "true" : "false" ) << '"';
    9935           0 :             return *this;
    9936             :         }
    9937             :

    9940           0 :             std::ostringstream oss;

    9942           0 :             return writeAttribute( name, oss.str() );

    9944             : 
    9945           0 :         XmlWriter& writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent = true ) {
    9946           0 :             if( !text.empty() ){
    9947           0 :                 bool tagWasOpen = m_tagIsOpen;
    9948           0 :                 ensureTagClosed();

    9950           0 :                     m_os << m_indent;
    9951           0 :                 m_os << XmlEncode( text );
    9952           0 :                 m_needsNewline = true;
    9953             :             }
    9954           0 :             return *this;
    9955             :         }
    9956             : 
    9957             :         XmlWriter& writeComment( std::string const& text ) {

    9960             :             m_needsNewline = true;

   10082           0 :         virtual void sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {

   10085           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Section" )
   10086           0 :                     .writeAttribute( "name", trim( sectionInfo.name ) )
   10087           0 :                     .writeAttribute( "description", sectionInfo.description );

   10090             :             }
   10091           0 :         }
   10092             : 
   10093           0 :         virtual void assertionStarting( AssertionInfo const& ) CATCH_OVERRIDE { }
   10094             : 
   10095           0 :         virtual bool assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
   10096             : 
   10097           0 :             AssertionResult const& result = assertionStats.assertionResult;
   10098             : 
   10099           0 :             bool includeResults = m_config->includeSuccessfulResults() || !result.isOk();
   10100             : 
   10101           0 :             if( includeResults ) {
   10102             :                 // Print any info messages in <Info> tags.
   10103           0 :                 for( std::vector<MessageInfo>::const_iterator it = assertionStats.infoMessages.begin(), itEnd = assertionStats.infoMessages.end();
   10104             :                      it != itEnd;
   10105             :                      ++it ) {
   10106           0 :                     if( it->type == ResultWas::Info ) {
   10107           0 :                         m_xml.scopedElement( "Info" )
   10108           0 :                                 .writeText( it->message );
   10109           0 :                     } else if ( it->type == ResultWas::Warning ) {
   10110           0 :                         m_xml.scopedElement( "Warning" )
   10111           0 :                                 .writeText( it->message );
   10112             :                     }
   10113             :                 }
   10114             :             }
   10115             : 
   10116             :             // Drop out if result was successful but we're not printing them.
   10117           0 :             if( !includeResults && result.getResultType() != ResultWas::Warning )
   10118           0 :                 return true;
   10119             : 
   10120             :             // Print the expression if there is one.
   10121           0 :             if( result.hasExpression() ) {
   10122           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Expression" )
   10123           0 :                     .writeAttribute( "success", result.succeeded() )
   10124           0 :                     .writeAttribute( "type", result.getTestMacroName() );
   10125             : 
   10126           0 :                 writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   10127             : 
   10128           0 :                 m_xml.scopedElement( "Original" )
   10129           0 :                     .writeText( result.getExpression() );
   10130           0 :                 m_xml.scopedElement( "Expanded" )
   10131           0 :                     .writeText( result.getExpandedExpression() );
   10132             :             }
   10133             : 
   10134             :             // And... Print a result applicable to each result type.
   10135           0 :             switch( result.getResultType() ) {
   10136             :                 case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   10137           0 :                     m_xml.startElement( "Exception" );
   10138           0 :                     writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   10139           0 :                     m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   10140           0 :                     m_xml.endElement();
   10141           0 :                     break;
   10142             :                 case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   10143           0 :                     m_xml.startElement( "FatalErrorCondition" );
   10144           0 :                     writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   10145           0 :                     m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   10146           0 :                     m_xml.endElement();

   10562           0 :         class AssertionPrinter {
   10563             :             void operator= ( AssertionPrinter const& );
   10564             :         public:
   10565           0 :             AssertionPrinter( std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages )
   10566           0 :             :   stream( _stream ),
   10567             :                 stats( _stats ),
   10568             :                 result( _stats.assertionResult ),
   10569             :                 colour( Colour::None ),
   10570           0 :                 message( result.getMessage() ),
   10571             :                 messages( _stats.infoMessages ),
   10572           0 :                 printInfoMessages( _printInfoMessages )
   10573             :             {
   10574           0 :                 switch( result.getResultType() ) {
   10575             :                     case ResultWas::Ok:
   10576           0 :                         colour = Colour::Success;
   10577           0 :                         passOrFail = "PASSED";
   10578             :                         //if( result.hasMessage() )
   10579           0 :                         if( _stats.infoMessages.size() == 1 )
   10580           0 :                             messageLabel = "with message";

   10582           0 :                             messageLabel = "with messages";
   10583           0 :                         break;

   10586           0 :                             colour = Colour::Success;
   10587           0 :                             passOrFail = "FAILED - but was ok";
   10588             :                         }
   10589             :                         else {
   10590           0 :                             colour = Colour::Error;
   10591           0 :                             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   10592             :                         }

   10594           0 :                             messageLabel = "with message";

   10596           0 :                             messageLabel = "with messages";
   10597           0 :                         break;
   10598             :                     case ResultWas::ThrewException:

   10603           0 :                             messageLabel += "message";

   10605           0 :                             messageLabel += "messages";
   10606           0 :                         break;

   10608           0 :                         colour = Colour::Error;
   10609           0 :                         passOrFail = "FAILED";
   10610           0 :                         messageLabel = "due to a fatal error condition";
   10611           0 :                         break;
   10612             :                     case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:

   10614           0 :                         passOrFail = "FAILED";

   10616           0 :                         break;
   10617             :                     case ResultWas::Info:
   10618           0 :                         messageLabel = "info";
   10619           0 :                         break;
   10620             :                     case ResultWas::Warning:
   10621           0 :                         messageLabel = "warning";
   10622           0 :                         break;

   10624           0 :                         passOrFail = "FAILED";

   10810           1 :         void printTotals( Totals const& totals ) {
   10811           1 :             if( totals.testCases.total() == 0 ) {
   10812           0 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Warning ) << "No tests ran\n";

   10817           3 :                         << pluralise( totals.assertions.passed, "assertion" ) << " in "
   10818           3 :                         << pluralise( totals.testCases.passed, "test case" ) << ')'
   10819           1 :                         << '\n';
   10820             :             }
   10821             :             else {
   10822             : 
   10823           0 :                 std::vector<SummaryColumn> columns;

   10840           1 :         }
   10841           0 :         void printSummaryRow( std::string const& label, std::vector<SummaryColumn> const& cols, std::size_t row ) {

   10860           3 :         static std::size_t makeRatio( std::size_t number, std::size_t total ) {
   10861           3 :             std::size_t ratio = total > 0 ? CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH * number/ total : 0;
   10862           3 :             return ( ratio == 0 && number > 0 ) ? 1 : ratio;
   10863             :         }
   10864           1 :         static std::size_t& findMax( std::size_t& i, std::size_t& j, std::size_t& k ) {
   10865           1 :             if( i > j && i > k )
   10866           0 :                 return i;
   10867           1 :             else if( j > k )
   10868           0 :                 return j;
   10869             :             else
   10870           1 :                 return k;
   10871             :         }
   10872             : 
   10873           1 :         void printTotalsDivider( Totals const& totals ) {
   10874           1 :             if( totals.testCases.total() > 0 ) {
   10875           1 :                 std::size_t failedRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.failed, totals.testCases.total() );
   10876           1 :                 std::size_t failedButOkRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.failedButOk, totals.testCases.total() );
   10877           1 :                 std::size_t passedRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.passed, totals.testCases.total() );
   10878           1 :                 while( failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1 )
   10879           0 :                     findMax( failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio )++;
   10880           3 :                 while( failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio > CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1 )
   10881           1 :                     findMax( failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio )--;
   10882             : 
   10883           1 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Error ) << std::string( failedRatio, '=' );
   10884           1 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::ResultExpectedFailure ) << std::string( failedButOkRatio, '=' );
   10885           1 :                 if( totals.testCases.allPassed() )
   10886           1 :                     stream << Colour( Colour::ResultSuccess ) << std::string( passedRatio, '=' );
   10887             :                 else
   10888           0 :                     stream << Colour( Colour::Success ) << std::string( passedRatio, '=' );
   10889             :             }
   10890             :             else {
   10891           0 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Warning ) << std::string( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1, '=' );
   10892             :             }
   10893           1 :             stream << '\n';
   10894           1 :         }
